OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
005 Atglen
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
005 Atglen
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
005 ATGLEN
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
NOVEMBER 2, 2021
Chester County Board of Elections
Typ:01 Seq:0001 Spl:01
PLEASE CONTINUE VOTING ON THE REVERSE
SIDE OF YOUR BALLOT FOR ADDITIONAL
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a vote
for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not timely
received by the commission and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropriate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to the
elector's polling place, remits the ballot and the
envelope containing the declaration of the elector
to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs
a statement subject to the penalties under 18
Pa.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn
falsification to authorities) to the same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's mail-in
ballot to the elector's polling place, remits the
ballot and the envelope containing the
declaration of the elector to the Judge of
Elections to be spoiled and signs a statement
subject to the penalties of 18 Pa.C.S. ยง 4904
(relating to the unsworn falsification to
authorities) to the same effect."
CONTESTS AND QUESTIONS.

OFFICIAL JUDICIAL RETENTION
QUESTIONS INSTRUCTIONS TO
VOTER
To vote in FAVOR of the retention,
blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word YES.
To vote AGAINST the retention,
blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word NO.

FOLLOWING JUDICIAL RETENTION
QUESTIONS

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
010 Avondale
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the

for a new ballot.

BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose

for a new ballot.

absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER

BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose

oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and

provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the

AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the

for a new ballot.

voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

QUESTIONS INSTRUCTIONS TO
VOTER
To vote in FAVOR of the retention,
blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word YES.
To vote AGAINST the retention,
blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word NO.

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
021 E Bradford N-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
021 E Bradford N-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
021 E BRADFORD N-2
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."

voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
030 W Bradford 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
030 W Bradford 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
030 W BRADFORD 2
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

vote for that candidate.

AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the

for a new ballot.

absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

036 E Brandywine N-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
036 E Brandywine N-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
043 W Brandywine W
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
043 W Brandywine W
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
043 W BRANDYWINE W
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
054 Caln 4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
054 Caln 4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.

absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the

the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
065 Charlestown
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
065 Charlestown
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
100 Coatesville 4-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
100 Coatesville 4-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
100 COATESVILLE 4-1

BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the

the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and

elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."

voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

150 N Coventry M
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
165 E Coventry 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
165 E Coventry 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
165 E COVENTRY 2
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the

vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose

oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and

for a new ballot.

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
185 W Downingtown N
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
185 W Downingtown N
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
185 W DOWNINGTOWN N
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

201 Easttown 3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
201 Easttown 3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
201 EASTTOWN 3
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word YES.

blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word NO.

of Pennsylvania?

15th Judicial District, Chester

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
204 Easttown 4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
215 Elk
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
215 Elk
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
235 W Fallowfield
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
235 W Fallowfield
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
235 W FALLOWFIELD
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
245 E Goshen 3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
245 E Goshen 3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

for a new ballot.

oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

250 E Goshen 8
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
250 E Goshen 8
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL JUDICIAL RETENTION
QUESTIONS INSTRUCTIONS TO
VOTER
To vote in FAVOR of the retention,
blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word YES.
To vote AGAINST the retention,
blacken the oval ( ) to the left of the
word NO.
VOTE ON EACH OF THE
FOLLOWING JUDICIAL RETENTION
QUESTIONS

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
261 W Goshen N-3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
261 W Goshen N-3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
261 W GOSHEN N-3

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not

elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."

voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
275 W Goshen S-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
275 W Goshen S-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
275 W GOSHEN S-1
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
290 Highland
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
290 Highland
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

for a new ballot.

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
310 Kennett Square S-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
310 Kennett Square S-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
310 KENNETT SQUARE S-1

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
328 Kennett Township 3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
328 Kennett Township 3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

for a new ballot.

left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
345 London Grove S
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
345 London Grove S
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
356 E Marlborough S - 02
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
356 E Marlborough S - 02
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
356 E MARLBOROUGH S - 02
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
375 E Nantmeal
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
375 E Nantmeal
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
375 E NANTMEAL

for a new ballot.

who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
395 New London
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
395 New London
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
