OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
410 W Nottingham
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
410 W Nottingham
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
410 W NOTTINGHAM
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
430 Lower Oxford W
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
430 Lower Oxford W
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
430 LOWER OXFORD W

only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
453 Pennsbury N-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
453 Pennsbury N-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

word NO.

461 Phoenixville N-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
461 Phoenixville N-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
468 Phoenixville M-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
468 Phoenixville M-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
474 Phoenixville E-3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
474 Phoenixville E-3
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
474 PHOENIXVILLE E-3
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on

elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
515 E Pikeland 1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
515 E Pikeland 1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

535 Sadsbury N
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
535 Sadsbury N
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
555 Schuylkill 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
555 Schuylkill 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

Yes
No

Election Question

retained for an additional term as
Judge of the Court of Common Pleas,
15th Judicial District, Chester
County?

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
565 Spring City 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
565 Spring City 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

containing the declaration of the elector to the

statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
585 Tredyffrin E-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
585 Tredyffrin E-1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
605 Tredyffrin E-5
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
605 Tredyffrin E-5
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
605 TREDYFFRIN E-5
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

for a new ballot.

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
617 TREDYFFRIN M-4
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose

write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on

elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and

elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."

voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
635 Tredyffrin W-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
635 Tredyffrin W-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
635 TREDYFFRIN W-2

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
653 Uwchlan 1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
653 Uwchlan 1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
657 Uwchlan 5
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
657 UWCHLAN 5
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
658 Uwchlan 6
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
665 Upper Uwchlan 1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
665 Upper Uwchlan 1
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
671 Valley N-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
671 Valley N-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
671 VALLEY N-2
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
681 E Vincent 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
681 E Vincent 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
681 E VINCENT 2
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.

for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector

section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
695 Wallace
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
695 Wallace
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
715 West Grove 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
715 West Grove 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
715 WEST GROVE 2
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the

for a new ballot.

the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania?

No
Court of Common Pleas Retention
Election Question
Shall Ann Marie Wheatcraft be
retained for an additional term as
Judge of the Court of Common Pleas,
15th Judicial District, Chester
County?
Yes

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
733 Westtown 4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
733 Westtown 4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the

vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on

the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and

elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."

voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

for a new ballot.

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
750 E Whiteland 4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
750 E Whiteland 4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
750 E WHITELAND 4
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may

place, remits the ballot and the envelope

ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
760 W Whiteland 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
760 W Whiteland 2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
760 W WHITELAND 2
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

for a new ballot.

only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
765 W Whiteland 7
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
765 W Whiteland 7
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
785 Willistown N-4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
785 Willistown N-4
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
785 WILLISTOWN N-4
COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, COUNTY OF CHESTER

for a new ballot.

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the

OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
805 Willistown S-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL ELECTION BALLOT
805 Willistown S-2
County of Chester, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
Municipal Election - November 2, 2021
INSTRUCTIONS TO VOTER
1. TO VOTE YOU MUST COMPLETELY
BLACKEN THE OVAL ( ) TO THE LEFT OF
YOUR CHOICE. An oval ( ) blackened to the
left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
805 WILLISTOWN S-2

2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose

AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.

5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.

absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on

under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the

same effect."

left of the name of any candidate indicates a
vote for that candidate.
2. To cast a write-in vote for a person whose
name is not on the ballot, you must blacken the
oval ( ) to the left of the line provided, and
write or print the name in the blank space
provided for that purpose.
3. To vote in FAVOR of a Question, fill in the
oval ( ) to the left of the word YES. To vote
AGAINST a Question, fill in the oval ( ) to the
left of the word NO.
4. Use only black ink pen.
5. If you make a mistake DO NOT ERASE. Ask
for a new ballot.
6. For Absentee Ballot Voters: "The official
absentee voter ballot shall state that an elector
who receives an absentee ballot pursuant to
section 1301 and whose voted ballot is not
timely received by the commision and who, on
Election Day, is capable of voting at the
appropiate polling place may only vote on
Election Day by provisional ballot unless the
elector brings the elector's absentee ballot to
the elector's polling place, remits the ballot and
the envelope containing the declaration of the
elector to the Judge of Elections to be spoiled
and signs a statement subject to the penaties
under 18 PA.C.S. ยง 4904 (relating to the
unsworn falsification to the authorities) to the
same effect."
7. For Mail-in Ballot Voters: "The official mail-in
voter ballot shall state that a voter who receives
a mail-in ballot under section 1301-D and whose
voted mail-in ballot is not timely received may
only vote on Election Day by provisional ballot
unless the elector brings the elector's polling
place, remits the ballot and the envelope
containing the declaration of the elector to the
Judge of Elections to be spoiled and signs a
statement subject to the penalties of 18 PA.C.S.
ยง 4904 (relating to the unsworn falsification to
the authorities) to the same effect."
